Model

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Player instances and hold all their attributes along with the necessary methods.
    Author:
    Stavros Argyrou AM:2962

      This is the Constructor of the Player method that creates a player with a Name, and a Team

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String Name,
              int team)

        team - this represents the Team of the player (RED = 0,Blue = 1)

    • Method Detail

      • isDefeated

        public boolean isDefeated()
        This method is used to access the methods private boolean field isDefeated, which will be true if the player lost, and false when the player is still in game
        Returns:
        the value of the isDefeated boolean indicating if the player lost or not.

      • setTeam

        public void setTeam(int team)
        Sets the Team of the player according to the integer given as a parameter
        Parameters:
        team - holds the integer value of the players team. Must be either 0 (RED) or 1 (BLUE)

        public boolean isMyTurn()
        This method can access the MyTurn variable when we need to see if is this player's turn
        Returns:

      • getPlayerUnits

        public Unit[] getPlayerUnits()
        This method is responsible to access the array that holds the player's units and return it as an array when called.
        Returns:
        an array that holds all the player's units currently in game

      • setPlayerUnits

        public void setPlayerUnits(Unit[] playerUnits)
        This gives the player its Units when the game starts and also updates its units when a unit is lost - defeated
        Parameters:
        playerUnits - an array of Units that are currently in game for this player

      • getDefeatedUnits

        public Unit[] getDefeatedUnits()
        Gets the player's Units that are currently defeated
        Returns:
        the array holding the defeated Units
